verses.text: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon , and all his army , and all the kingdoms of the earth of his dominion , and all the people , fought against Jerusalem , and against all the cities thereof, saying ,\f + \fr 34.1 \ft of his…: Heb. the dominion of his hand\f*

Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the God of Israel ; Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah , and tell him, Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon , and he shall burn it with fire :

And thou shalt not escape out of his hand , but shalt surely be taken , and delivered into his hand ; and thine eyes shall behold the eyes of the king of Babylon , and he shall speak with thee mouth to mouth , and thou shalt go to Babylon.\f + \fr 34.3 \ft he shall…: Heb. his mouth shall speak to thy mouth\f*

Yet hear the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, O Zedekiah king of Judah ; Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of thee, Thou shalt not die by the sword :

\add But\add* thou shalt die in peace : and with the burnings of thy fathers , the former kings which were before thee, so shall they burn \add odours\add* for thee; and they will lament thee, \add saying\add*, Ah lord ! for I have pronounced the word , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Then Jeremiah the prophet spake all these words unto Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem ,

When the king of Babylon’s army fought against Jerusalem , and against all the cities of Judah that were left , against Lachish , and against Azekah : for these defenced cities remained of the cities of Judah. \p

¶ \add This is\add* the word that came unto Jeremiah from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people which \add were\add* at Jerusalem , to proclaim liberty unto them;

That every man should let his manservant , and every man his maidservant , \add being\add* an Hebrew or an Hebrewess , go free ; that none should serve himself of them, \add to wit\add*, of a Jew his brother.

Now when all the princes , and all the people , which had entered into the covenant , heard that every one should let his manservant , and every one his maidservant , go free , that none should serve themselves of them any more, then they obeyed , and let \add them\add* go.
But afterward they turned , and caused the servants and the handmaids , whom they had let go free , to return , and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids. \p

¶ Therefore the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* came to Jeremiah from the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, saying ,

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of Israel ; I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt , out of the house of bondmen , saying ,

At the end of seven years let ye go every man his brother an Hebrew , which hath been sold unto thee; and when he hath served thee six years , thou shalt let him go free from thee: but your fathers hearkened not unto me, neither inclined their ear.\f + \fr 34.14 \ft hath been…: or, hath sold himself\f*

And ye were now turned , and had done right in my sight , in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbour ; and ye had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name :\f + \fr 34.15 \ft now: Heb. to day\f*\f + \fr 34.15 \ft which…: Heb. whereupon my name is called\f*

But ye turned and polluted my name , and caused every man his servant , and every man his handmaid , whom ye had set at liberty at their pleasure , to return , and brought them into subjection , to be unto you for servants and for handmaids.

Therefore thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; Ye have not hearkened unto me, in proclaiming liberty , every one to his brother , and every man to his neighbour : behold, I proclaim a liberty for you, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to the sword , to the pestilence , and to the famine ; and I will make you to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.  +  r 34.17  t to be…: Heb. for a removing *

And I will give the men that have transgressed my covenant , which have not performed the words of the covenant which they had made before me, when they cut the calf in twain , and passed between the parts thereof,
The princes of Judah , and the princes of Jerusalem , the eunuchs , and the priests , and all the people of the land , which passed between the parts of the calf ;

I will even give them into the hand of their enemies , and into the hand of them that seek their life : and their dead bodies shall be for meat unto the fowls of the heaven , and to the beasts of the earth.

And Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes will I give into the hand of their enemies , and into the hand of them that seek their life , and into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army , which are gone up from you.

Behold, I will command , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and cause them to return to this city ; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire : and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without an inhabitant.
